Uses of Class
JavaKillers.DBAppException

  • Uses of DBAppException in JavaKillers

    Methods in JavaKillers that throw DBAppException 
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static boolean DBApp.checkDelete​(java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> cols, java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> htblColNameValue)
    checkDelete
    void DBApp.createTable​(java.lang.String strTableName, java.lang.String strClusteringKeyColumn, java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> htblColNameType)
    The createTable method takes the table name, the clustering key and a hashtable containing the columns' names and their datatypes.
    void DBApp.deleteFromTable​(java.lang.String strTableName, java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> htblColNameValue)
    The deleteFromTable method takes the table name and the attributes of the records that should be deleted.
    void DBApp.insertIntoTable​(java.lang.String strTableName, java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> htblColNameValue)
    The insertIntoTable method takes parameters: the table name, the tuple to be inserted in the form of a hashtable.
    java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> DBApp.readFromCSV​(java.lang.String tableName)
    The readFromCSV method takes the table name as a parameter and returns the columns' names and data types so we can check the data and their types upon insertion,update or deletion.
    static void DBApp.Serialize​(java.lang.String name, java.io.Serializable obj)
    The Seralize method takes the name of the file and serialize the object into the hard disk.
    void DBApp.testpage​(java.lang.String tablename)
    The testPages method prints the records in every page in a certain table.
    void DBApp.writeIntoCSV​(java.lang.String strTableName, java.lang.String strClusteringKeyColumn, java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> htblColNameType)
    The writeIntoCSV method takes the table name and the hashtable containing the columns' names and data types as parameters and add them in the metadata file in csv format.
